get.summary: Get the health of the service
get.description: Check the health of the service.

400.description:
Bad requests generally mean the client has passed invalid 
    or malformed parameters. Error messages in the response could help in 
    evaluating the error.

401.description:
When a client attempts to access resources that require 
    authorization credentials but the client lacks proper authentication 
    in the request, the server responds with 401.

403.description:
When a client attempts to access resources with valid
    credentials but doesn't have the privilege to perform that action, 
    the server responds with 403.

404.description:
The error is mostly returned when the client requests
    with either mistyped URL, or the passed resource is moved or deleted, 
    or the resource doesn't exist.

429.description:
This error is returned when the client has sent too many,
    and has hit the rate limit.

500.description:
The error is a generic server side error that is 
    returned for any uncaught and unexpected issues on the server side. 
    This should be very rare, and you may reach out to us if the problem 
    persists for a longer duration.

502.description:
This is an internal error indicating invalid response 
      received by the client-facing proxy or gateway from the upstream server.

503.description:
The error is returned for certain routes on a particular
    Subnet. This indicates an internal problem with our Subnet node, and may 
    not necessarily mean the Subnet is down or affected.

get.description:
EVM chain metrics are available for all Avalanche L1s on _Mainnet_ and _Fuji_ (testnet). You can request metrics by EVM chain ID. See the `/chains` endpoint for all supported chains.

All metrics are updated several times every hour. Each metric data point has a `value` and `timestamp` (Unix timestamp in seconds). All metric values include data within the duration of the associated timestamp plus the requested `timeInterval`. All timestamps are fixed to the hour. When requesting a timeInterval of **day**, **week**, or **month**, the timestamp will be 0:00 UTC of the day, Monday of the week, or first day of the month, respectively. The latest data point in any response may change on each update.

### Metrics

<ins>activeAddresses</ins>: The number of distinct addresses seen within the selected `timeInterval` starting at the timestamp. Addresses counted are those that appear in the “from” and “to” fields of a transaction or ERC20/ERC721/ERC1155 transfer log event.

<ins>activeSenders</ins>: This metric follows the same structure as activeAddresses, but instead only counts addresses that appear in the “from” field of the respective transaction or transfer log event.

<ins>cumulativeTxCount</ins>: The cumulative transaction count from genesis up until 24 hours after the timestamp. This aggregation can be considered a “rolling sum” of the transaction count metric (txCount). Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>cumulativeAddresses</ins>: The cumulative count of unique addresses from genesis up until 24 hours after the timestamp. Addresses counted are those that appear in the “from” and “to” fields of a transaction or ERC20/ERC721/ERC1155 transfer log event. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>cumulativeContracts</ins>: The cumulative count of contracts created from genesis up until the timestamp.  Contracts are counted by looking for the CREATE, CREATE2, and CREATE3 call types in all transaction traces (aka internal transactions). Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>cumulativeDeployers</ins>: The cumulative count of unique contract deployers from genesis up until 24 hours after the timestamp. Deployers counted are those that appear in the “from” field of transaction traces with the CREATE, CREATE2, and CREATE3 call types. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>contracts</ins>: The count of contracts created within the requested timeInterval starting at the timestamp. Contracts are counted by looking for the CREATE, CREATE2, and CREATE3 call types in all transaction traces (aka internal transactions). Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>deployers</ins>: The count of unique deployers within the requested timeInterval starting at the timestamp. Deployers counted are those that appear in the “from” field of transaction traces with the CREATE, CREATE2, and CREATE3 call types. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>gasUsed</ins>: The amount of gas used by transactions within the requested timeInterval starting at the timestamp.

<ins>txCount</ins>: The amount of transactions within the requested timeInterval starting at the timestamp.

<ins>avgGps</ins>: The average Gas used Per Second (GPS) within the day beginning at the timestamp.  The average is calculated by taking the sum of gas used by all blocks within the day and dividing it by the time interval between the last block of the previous day and the last block of the day that begins at the timestamp.  Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>maxGps</ins>: The max Gas used Per Second (GPS)  measured within the day beginning at the timestamp. Each GPS data point is calculated using the gas used in a single block divided by the time since the last block. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>avgTps</ins>: The average Transactions Per Second (TPS) within the day beginning at the timestamp. The average is calculated by taking the sum of transactions within the day and dividing it by the time interval between the last block of the previous day and the last block of the day that begins at the timestamp. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>maxTps</ins>: The max Transactions Per Second (TPS) measured within the day beginning at the timestamp. Each TPS data point is calculated by taking the number of transactions in a single block and dividing it by the time since the last block. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>avgGasPrice</ins>: The average gas price within the day beginning at the timestamp. The gas price used is the price reported in transaction receipts. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>maxGasPrice</ins>: The max gas price seen within the day beginning at the timestamp. The gas price used is the price reported in transaction receipts. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

<ins>feesPaid</ins>: The sum of transaction fees paid within the day beginning at the timestamp. The fee is calculated as the gas used multiplied by the gas price as reported in all transaction receipts. Only `timeInterval=day` supported.

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: Which chain level metric to fetch.

parameters.name: startTimestamp
parameters.description: Query param for retrieving items after a specific timestamp.

parameters.name: endTimestamp
parameters.description: Query param for retrieving items before a specific timestamp.

parameters.name: timeInterval
parameters.description:
Time interval granularity for data aggregation. Metrics
    prefixed with "cumulative", "max", or "avg" only support timeInterval equal
    to "day".

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: A page token, received from a previous list call. Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. The minimum page size is 1. The maximum pageSize is 2160.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: A supported EVM chain ID or one of "total", "mainnet", or "testnet". Use the `/chains` endpoint to get a list of supported chain IDs.

400.description:
Bad requests generally mean the client has passed invalid 
    or malformed parameters. Error messages in the response could help in 
    evaluating the error.

401.description:
When a client attempts to access resources that require 
    authorization credentials but the client lacks proper authentication 
    in the request, the server responds with 401.

403.description:
When a client attempts to access resources with valid
    credentials but doesn't have the privilege to perform that action, 
    the server responds with 403.

404.description:
The error is mostly returned when the client requests
    with either mistyped URL, or the passed resource is moved or deleted, 
    or the resource doesn't exist.

429.description:
This error is returned when the client has sent too many,
    and has hit the rate limit.

500.description:
The error is a generic server side error that is 
    returned for any uncaught and unexpected issues on the server side. 
    This should be very rare, and you may reach out to us if the problem 
    persists for a longer duration.

502.description:
This is an internal error indicating invalid response 
      received by the client-facing proxy or gateway from the upstream server.

503.description:
The error is returned for certain routes on a particular
    Subnet. This indicates an internal problem with our Subnet node, and may 
    not necessarily mean the Subnet is down or affected.

get.description:
Get historical ICM message counts with flexible grouping.

Use filters (`srcBlockchainId`, `destBlockchainId`, `network`)  to select data, and the `groupBy` parameter for aggregation level.

### Examples:

  - **Specific pair**:   `?srcBlockchainId=...&destBlockchainId=...`

  - **From one source (aggregated)**: `?srcBlockchainId=...`

  - **From one source (by destination)**:   `?srcBlockchainId=...&groupBy=destBlockchainId`

  - **To one destination (aggregated)**: `?destBlockchainId=...`

  - **To one destination (by source)**:   `?destBlockchainId=...&groupBy=srcBlockchainId`

  - **Network total**: `?network=mainnet`

  - **Network breakdown**:   `?network=mainnet&groupBy=srcBlockchainId,destBlockchainId`.

parameters.name: startTimestamp
parameters.description: Query param for retrieving items after a specific timestamp.

parameters.name: endTimestamp
parameters.description: Query param for retrieving items before a specific timestamp.

parameters.name: srcBlockchainId
parameters.description: Query param for retrieving items for a specific source (initiating) blockchain id.

parameters.name: destBlockchainId
parameters.description: Query param for retrieving items for a specific destination (receiving) blockchain id.

parameters.name: timeInterval
parameters.description:
Time interval granularity for data aggregation. Metrics
    prefixed with "cumulative", "max", or "avg" only support timeInterval equal
    to "day".

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: A page token, received from a previous list call. Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. The minimum page size is 1. The maximum pageSize is 2160.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: Group results by srcBlockchainId, destBlockchainId, or both (comma-separated)

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: Either mainnet or testnet/fuji.

400.description:
Bad requests generally mean the client has passed invalid 
    or malformed parameters. Error messages in the response could help in 
    evaluating the error.

401.description:
When a client attempts to access resources that require 
    authorization credentials but the client lacks proper authentication 
    in the request, the server responds with 401.

403.description:
When a client attempts to access resources with valid
    credentials but doesn't have the privilege to perform that action, 
    the server responds with 403.

404.description:
The error is mostly returned when the client requests
    with either mistyped URL, or the passed resource is moved or deleted, 
    or the resource doesn't exist.

429.description:
This error is returned when the client has sent too many,
    and has hit the rate limit.

500.description:
The error is a generic server side error that is 
    returned for any uncaught and unexpected issues on the server side. 
    This should be very rare, and you may reach out to us if the problem 
    persists for a longer duration.

502.description:
This is an internal error indicating invalid response 
      received by the client-facing proxy or gateway from the upstream server.

503.description:
The error is returned for certain routes on a particular
    Subnet. This indicates an internal problem with our Subnet node, and may 
    not necessarily mean the Subnet is down or affected.

parameters.description: A page token, received from a previous list call. Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. The minimum page size is 1. The maximum pageSize is 5000.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: A supported evm chain id. Use the `/chains` endpoint to get a list of supported chain ids.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Contract address on the relevant chain.

400.description:
Bad requests generally mean the client has passed invalid 
    or malformed parameters. Error messages in the response could help in 
    evaluating the error.

401.description:
When a client attempts to access resources that require 
    authorization credentials but the client lacks proper authentication 
    in the request, the server responds with 401.

403.description:
When a client attempts to access resources with valid
    credentials but doesn't have the privilege to perform that action, 
    the server responds with 403.

404.description:
The error is mostly returned when the client requests
    with either mistyped URL, or the passed resource is moved or deleted, 
    or the resource doesn't exist.

429.description:
This error is returned when the client has sent too many,
    and has hit the rate limit.

500.description:
The error is a generic server side error that is 
    returned for any uncaught and unexpected issues on the server side. 
    This should be very rare, and you may reach out to us if the problem 
    persists for a longer duration.

502.description:
This is an internal error indicating invalid response 
      received by the client-facing proxy or gateway from the upstream server.

503.description:
The error is returned for certain routes on a particular
    Subnet. This indicates an internal problem with our Subnet node, and may 
    not necessarily mean the Subnet is down or affected.

get.summary: Get addresses by balance over time
get.description: Get list of addresses and their latest balances that have held more than a certain threshold of a given token during the specified time frame.

parameters.description: The minimum balance for which addresses should be considered.

info.title: Metrics API
info.description:
The Metrics API provides metrics and analytics of on-chain activity. The API is in Beta and may be subject to change.

If you have feedback or feature requests for the API, please submit them here. Bug reports can be submitted here, and any potential security issues can be reported here.

tags.name: EVM Chains
tags.description: Find information about which routes are supported for a given EVM chainID.

tags.name: Chain Metrics
tags.description: Get network level staking and usage metrics.

tags.name: L1 Validator Metrics
tags.description: Get network level l1 validator metrics.

tags.name: Looking Glass
tags.description: Looking Glass is a tool that allows users to look up information for future airdrops.

tags.name: Chain Throughput
tags.description: Get throughput metrics for a given chain.

tags.name: Cumulative
tags.description: Get cumulative metrics for a given chain.

tags.name: Staking Information
tags.description: Get staking information for a given chain.

NetworkType.description: Network on which this blockchain or subnet is created on.

chainName.description: Blockchain alias for easy identification of blockchains.

blockchainId.description: Unique blockchain ID for this blockchain.

subnetId.description: Subnet ID this blockchain belongs to.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted or empty, there are no subsequent pages.

chains.description: Array of Subnet - EVM Chain ID mappings whose metrics we support.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted or empty, there are no subsequent pages.

chains.description: Array of Subnet - EVM Chain ID mappings whose metrics we support.

value.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics.

timestamp.description: Unix Epoch timestamp for which metrics are aggregated. Depending on the interval of the metric this can be at the start of the relevant hour, day, month, year, etc.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted or empty, there are no subsequent pages.

results.description: Array of current metrics values at different timestamps.

lastHour.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics in last hour.

lastDay.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics in last day.

lastWeek.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics in last week.

lastMonth.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics in last month.

last90Days.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics in last 90 days.

lastYear.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics in last year.

allTime.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics for all time.

result.description: Array of current metrics values for different windows.

value.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics.

result.description: current metrics value for a given teleporter metric.

value.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics.

timestamp.description: Unix Epoch timestamp for which metrics are aggregated. Depending on the interval of the metric this can be at the start of the relevant hour, day, month, year, etc.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted or empty, there are no subsequent pages.

results.description: Array of current ICM metrics values.

lastYear.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics in last year.

allTime.description: Aggregated value for the current metrics for all time.

result.description: Array of current metrics values for different windows.

sortKey.description: Route dependent value associated with an address at a given point in time.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted or empty, there are no subsequent pages.

addresses.description: List of addresses that match provided criteria.

totalHolders.description: Total number of holders of a given NFT project.

totalTokens.description: Total number of tokens of a given NFT project.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted or empty, there are no subsequent pages.

addresses.description: List of addresses that match provided criteria.

sortKey.description: Route dependent value associated with an address at a given point in time.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted or empty, there are no subsequent pages.

addresses.description: List of addresses that match provided criteria.

pageSize.description: The maximum number of items to return.

subQueryCounts.description: The number of results for each subquery by query id.

totalCount.description: The total number of addresses returned by the composite query.

GlobalParamChainId.name: chainId
GlobalParamChainId.description: A supported EVM chain id, chain alias, or blockchain id.

GlobalParamNetwork.name: network
GlobalParamNetwork.description: A supported network type mainnet or testnet/fuji.
